items.q: In golf, what is the term for completing a hole one stroke under par?
items.explanation: An eagle is two strokes under par, and a bogey is one stroke over par.

items.q: In baseball, the distance between each base is exactly 90 feet.
items.explanation: The bases form a perfect square, mathematically placed 90 feet apart from one another.

items.q: The Tour de France bicycle race always finishes in the city of Lyon.
items.explanation: The traditional and iconic final stage of the Tour de France always concludes on the Champs-Élysées in Paris.

items.q: Which sport features a 'scrum' to restart play?
items.explanation: It involves players packing closely together with their heads down and attempting to gain possession of the ball.

items.q: What is the maximum achievable break (score) in a single frame of professional snooker without any fouls by the opponent?
items.explanation: This requires potting all 15 reds with 15 blacks, followed by all six colored balls in sequence.

items.q: In standard ten-pin bowling, how many frames constitute a single complete game?
items.explanation: Players have up to two rolls per frame to knock down the pins, with a potential bonus roll in the tenth frame.

items.q: Which major tennis tournament is distinctively played on red clay courts?
items.explanation: The clay surface slows down the ball and strictly favors baseline players with high stamina.

items.q: How many players make up a standard curling team on the ice?
items.explanation: The positions are the lead, second, third, and the skip (captain).

items.q: What effectively is a 'triple-double' in the game of basketball?
items.a: A player recording double-digit totals in three of the five major statistical categories (points, rebounds, assists, steals, block) in a single game.
items.explanation: It demonstrates exceptional all-around contribution to the game.

items.q: In which physically demanding track and field event do athletes essentially hurl a heavy, long spear?
items.explanation: It requires significant upper body strength, technique, and incredible explosive power.
